Introduction

Kwon Hyuk-woo, better known by his stage name Loco, is a South Korean rapper signed to the hip hop label AOMG headed by Jay Park. His name "loco" means "crazy" in Spanish. He won the first season of Mnet's rap competition Show Me the Money in 2012. He debuted on Sept 4, 2012, with the single “See the Light".

Fun facts

1
His stage name “Loco” means “crazy” in Spanish.
…
2
He speaks English.
…
3
Loco enlisted on 7th February, 2019.
…
4
Loco is part of the cast for “It’s Dangerous Beyond the Blankets“.
…
5
Back in high school he used to listen a lot to Kanye West, which inspired him to write his own raps.
…
6
He stutters when talking, and that was one of the reasons he started rapping.
…
7
When he gets drunk he calls his stage name a lot.
…
8
In college he used to drink a lot before the shows, so people called him “crazy”, that’s when he got the idea of the stage name "Loco".
…
9
When Satgotbong was performing, all the group members were wearing sauna clothes, because they wanted to be different from any other group.
…
10
Loco has previously said that he lost weight (8 Kg) because when he had taken a photo with Jay Park and a few others behind the scenes at a Jay Park concert, he thought he looked like a pig.
